text: This bold, red headdress is of the type often referred to as "coral snakes."  Coral snakes are worn exclusively in the village of Tamah√∫.  According to Mayan belief, snakes are harbingers of rain, often depicted in visual expression as long, zig-zag forms. In this way, snakes are equated with lightning, a symbol of life-giving rain and a link between the heavens and the earth.  The color red is also synonymous with life. This headdress, worn close to a woman's head, signifies the east and the rising sun, blood, fire, and a woman's ability to create life.
title: Headdress (bac bal)
